Text: dreamweaver won't start after installation ....  resources.dll is a bad windows image? any idea how to fix this,
anyone else care to comment on how this might work?

I had no such problems. If you use Vista or Seven, try clicking the right button on the startup file and in Properties -> Compatibility, choose Windows XP SP3 or you can uninstall everything and redo the steps on the setup file. The only thing that comes to mind.

I'm getting the same problem as surfstu
even still after redownloading and installing everything and trying the compatibility trick. 

P.S. I'm on vista

I have experienced the same problem as surfstu and I am also running Vista Home Premium. The following message is returned when I try to run Dreamweaver.exe either in XP Compatibility mode or not: C:\Program Files\Adobe\Adobe Dreamweaver CS4\en_GB\Resources.dll is either not designed to run on Windows or it contains and error.

Note: The instruction in the English Readme.txt file to select the "paid" version is non sequitur as you cannot proceed without entering a product key if you do that so you must select the trial version which the Spanish version of Readme.txt got correct.

Sure would be nice if this worked.
